DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Preoperative Blood Not Tissue Banked Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason(s) that the pre-operative/pre-anesthesia blood samples were not received in the tissue bank as per the BPV Blood Collection and Processing SOP.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Preoperative Blood Not Tissue Banked
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.
